title: Can we get a way to report in lobby before a game even starts?
body:
I just queued for a bot game and had a hunch that two of my teammates were being botted. I used the website na.op.gg and my hunch was confirmed. Their last 10 matches had all the identifying factors involved. Heal and ghost every single game. Double digit deaths and a creep score below 30 every game. An itemization that includes 6 pairs of boots, a build that consists of nothing but 5 catalyst of the aeons and other spam item builds that are profoundly stupid followed by a game where they buy nothing at all. They are programmed to act like newbie players but when an account reaches level 20+ there should be red flags going up. This has been going on for months now which is unacceptable.

I've been told "just report them after game" and I do just that. Riot you rely on us to do your leg work on finding these things. I am an expert in identifying these bot accounts. I can pick one out just by spending 30 seconds with them in a lobby. And I have 100% accuracy in properly identifying a bot. Its not that hard to figure out when you have a bot in your game. I literally just told you some easy identifying factors already. They auto lock in lobby and say nothing. In game they say the same one word phrases so as to fool Riot's ban squad. "WTF" "Push" "Frozen" & "GJ" are the most frequent phrases. They only go up mid lane. They will suicide under turret for no apparent reason.

These bot accounts are a plague that is infesting the system. Their presence ensures that new players never make it into the system. Riot you are being sabotaged. You need to step up your game on handling this. At least make a public statement about it. I need to know that you are aware about it. You can tell me "we cannot divulge how we are handling this situation at this time" and I won't be upset, but can I at least hear that you are aware of what is going on? Ignoring this issue will lead to more serious and harder to detect issues down the line so its in your best interest and the interest of the community that you publicly announce that it is a problem and then actively do something about it. 

And while you're at it allow us to flag a teammate before a game whom we suspect to be a botter. Give us the tools to help us help you.

No, because you can still leave at that point without causing a disadvantage to your team. If you value 3lp more than the "toxicity" of that person, it clearly isn't bad.

But in a fair world they would lose the LP and have the leave penalty placed upon them.
They were toxic, not you.

Which is why vote kick should exist, but not pregame reporting. Obviously there needs to be safeguards in place to prevent abuse by premades and against kicking because you just don't think urgot is any good, but that would be a far better system to get toxic people out of your game early.

True.
And the system could keep track of players who constantly get vote-kicked and potentially punish them...  though I'm still afraid of how that might work for people who play unpopular champions.

100% agree.

I had to dodge a lobby and sent in a support ticket about this exact instance basically. Guy said "sorry guys im trolling this game" and locks in teemo. Then we said why and he just said "gonna intentionally feed".

Literally just made a post about this and how I just lost a ranked game after deciding not to dodge the trolls in my lobby for fear of being penalized. Which do you usually go with?

If there's someone threatening to troll/feed in a ranked game, I usually dodge it. It's not a long wait to re-queue the first time and you only loose a minimal amount of lp compared to loosing a match. Luckily, I haven't had to do it at all this season. I don't recommend doing it too much though because you'll get flagged for it.

As far as reports, you can screenshot the threats and send them into Riot via their support system.

I usually play the game. You never know, maybe you can still win it, and I *really* want to report this kind of behavior. I can take a loss in the short term if the community gets better in the long term. Exception is if I'm at 0 pts and on the verge of being demoted.
